title: Can someone who is unknown write a song for artists like Beyonce, Gaga and others? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, and no. Yes, because some of the songwriters who write songs for superstars are relatively unknown, and in some cases, these people are ghost writers - people who are hired by these artists and/or their producers to make music for them but are required to keep it a secret. No, because you have to be someone in the industry or community for anyone to pick up your work. Granted, you can be a nobody in the industry, a greenhorn songwriter for example, but you are a songwriter and it’s your job, so you’re still someone in the industry. By “nobody,” I mean something like an absolutely random fan or an aspiring songwriter who hasn’t even published a single piece of work.

Yes, absolutely. THE EASY PART - is getting material to an artist (or their manager, or a publisher, or a label etc). Every one those people is online usually with a website and a twitter. They aren’t hiding. Establishing a relationship takes a little tact, but is not difficult. THE HARD PART - is writing a song that will impress them.

All songwriters who are known were once unknown. So, they’ve managed to find a path from being unknown to being known. It’s an extremely difficult path to find, but it can be found if you have the talent, persistence, and luck. If you’re serious about pursuing it, make sure you learn the craft and the business.
